𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝗰𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗯𝘂𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁 𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲? Recently, I closed a business opportunity, and the client said he chose us for his experience with us. This got me thinking about how most guys are stuck on selling a product even though customers want a personalized experience before sales even happen. I’m not sure if convincing customers of a product’s benefits still works. I feel it’s a shot in the dark. If I have learned anything in this business, it’s this – customers are looking for a great experience in the sales journey. Crafting it is our responsibility. I believe these three lessons have helped my organization excel at sales by delivering an exceptional experience - 1. Listen to your customers. It will help you uncover their hidden desires and pain points, which will help you serve the right solution at each step in their journey. 2. Don’t sell a product, sell an experience. Customers can find valuable products everywhere. Can you give them a memorable experience? Sales happen as a byproduct of building a delightful customer journey. 3. Build a relationship. As cliche as it sounds, I am a strong proponent of building a relationship with your customers. My customers are happy because I genuinely care for their needs. My organization has trained sales guys to deliver a personalized experience to every prospect and customer. It will inevitably lead to sales. #customerexperience #customersatisfaction #salesstrategy #salesleadership

𝗟𝗶𝗳𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗲𝘁 𝗹𝗼𝘀𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗯𝗲𝗮𝘁. 𝗢𝗿 𝘀𝗼 𝗶𝘁 𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀. Thousands of flights grounded, medical procedures halted, schools, offices, and even basic purchases in supermarkets had hiccups. Our daily routine was disrupted, and how! All this is because of a failed update on a server. We focus on business as usual, but in fact, it is life as usual that comes to a standstill. That's how dependent we have become dependent on technology, the internet. Is it a good thing or bad? We cannot really sit on judgment But it is definitely a thought to reflect. Now is the time to think about what backup plans we can put in place if a catastrophic incident like this, which in all likelihood will happen again in some form or the other. Covid showed us the fury of nature. This worldwide outage brought to light the fault lines in technology. A black swan can just swim by at its will, causing ripples beyond our control. Time to hope for the best and be prepared for the worst, isn't it? Pic Credit - Freepik.com

AI is not really making the cyber world equal. Security threats continue to rise, enterprises continue to remain vulnerable. Hackers are making smart use of AI in orchestrating attacks. Businesses on the other hand are implementing AI tools to safeguard their systems and data. In this game, who will have the upper hand? In my recent conversations with some CISOs, the concerns regarding the effectiveness of tools are coming up quite a lot. Perhaps the challenge lies elsewhere. Ad hoc security patches are in fact part of the problem. Investments are being made but a cohesive security roadmap is still a work in progress. If miscreants can get creative with technologies, there is no question why we cannot play our hands well. Won't you agree? #AI #cyberattack #cybersecurity #cyberthreat

It's a race against time. Enterprises worldwide are rushing to migrate to S4/HANA before SAP ECC slips into sunset mode. However as per Gartner at the current pace, slightly more than half of 35,000 ECC customers are likely to meet the deadline. That doesn't sound promising enough, right? If you are still on fences, the time to make a decision is now. You will find some clear perspectives in this blog. https://lnkd.in/giw8tY4x

Conversations around cloud investments are changing. What began as a cost-saving exercise has come to cost dearly over a period of time. I met the CIO of a major healthcare company in Toronto last week. We were discussing the ways to secure their patient data while bringing a higher level of personalization. Interestingly, we spent the evening talking about the best ways to optimize their investments in the cloud. Turns out that the strategy was not thought through well. While some workloads were moved to the private cloud, others, more sensitive ones were on the public cloud. No wonder their spending outweighs the gains by miles. A planned approach that goes beyond immediate concerns and has farsight towards emerging business needs must precede any cloud deployment. Many companies rush to make initial cost savings but lose sight of optimization opportunities. How do you prioritize your investments, immediate cost savings, or long-term optimization? #cloudcomputing #cloudinvestment #cloudoptimization pic credit - freepik

Cybersecurity is now a major concern for all organizations across the globe. The increasing volume of sensitive data stored and shared online than ever before emphasizes the critical importance of implementing robust security measures. As industries rapidly expand, staying ahead of evolving cyber threats is imperative. Here are key areas identified to enhance organizational capabilities: 𝗔𝗱𝘃𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝗧𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁 𝗗𝗲𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Leveraging AI-driven algorithms for real-time anomaly detection and proactive threat identification. 𝗕𝗲𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗔𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘀𝗶𝘀: Utilizing machine learning to analyze user and system behavior, enhancing early threat detection capabilities. 𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗜𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗲: Implementing automated response mechanisms to swiftly mitigate threats and minimize potential impact. 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗘𝗻𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀: Strengthening our cloud security posture with enhanced visibility and control over cloud environments. 𝗨𝘀𝗲𝗿 𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴: Integrating interactive modules to continuously educate users on cybersecurity best practices. 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗖𝗮𝗽𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀: Facilitating seamless integration with third-party tools to create a cohesive security ecosystem and streamline operations. 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗚𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Strengthening compliance monitoring and governance features to ensure adherence to industry standards and regulations. 𝗧𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴: Enabling secure sharing of threat intelligence data to bolster collective defense strategies with trusted partners. 𝗘𝗻𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝗥𝗲𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗔𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘁𝗶𝗰𝘀: Providing detailed insights through customizable reporting and analytics dashboards for informed decision-making. 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Ensuring scalability to manage increasing data volumes while maintaining optimal performance under high loads. #Cybersecurity #Innovation #ThreatDetection #SecurityStrategy
